title: Agentic AI-Powered DevSecOps Framework - Thesis Evaluation Report

framework.name: Agentic AI-Powered DevSecOps Framework
framework.description: Multi-agent CI/CD security framework using Google ADK

RQ1.question: How effective is an autonomous multi-agent CI/CD framework at detecting security vulnerabilities and improving security assurance compared to traditional CI/CD automation approaches?
RQ1.findings: Framework detected 6 CWE-78 Command Injection vulnerabilities using Semgrep SAST in GitHub Actions workflows

RQ2.question: To what extent does the integration of runtime trace analysis and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) improve the correctness and robustness of LLM-generated CI/CD configurations compared to static-context approaches?
RQ2.findings: IAST agent implemented with runtime trace analysis capability

RQ3.question: How effectively does coordinated security testing using SAST, DAST, IAST, and SCA agents improve vulnerability detection and reduce false positives during CI/CD execution?
RQ3.findings: Coordinated scanning detected vulnerabilities across SAST (Semgrep) and SCA (pip-audit) tools

RQ4.question: What is the impact of intelligent test optimization techniques, including GNN-based dependency analysis and flaky test detection, on CI/CD pipeline execution time and reliability?
RQ4.findings: Bayesian flaky test tracker and GNN agent implemented, awaiting iDoFT evaluation

vulnerabilities.description: Shell injection via ${{ inputs.dataset }} in run step
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as $DATASET

vulnerabilities.description: Shell injection via ${{ inputs.dataset }} in case statement
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as $DATASET

vulnerabilities.description: Multiple shell injections via ${{ inputs }} interpolations
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as environment variables

vulnerabilities.description: Shell injection via ${{ inputs }} in summary generation
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as environment variables

vulnerabilities.description: Multiple shell injections in Python heredoc with dataset variable
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as os.environ['DATASET']

vulnerabilities.description: Shell injection via ${{ inputs }} in report generation
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Use env: block to store inputs, then reference as environment variables

gnn_agent.description: Test impact prediction via dependency graph analysis

auto_remediation.description: ConfigAutoPilot agent generates PRs with fixes based on user preferences

decision_gate.description: Auto-approve if confidence > 0.85, else route to human review

conclusion.summary: The Agentic AI-Powered DevSecOps Framework successfully demonstrated multi-agent security scanning capabilities. The SAST agent detected 6 high-severity Command Injection vulnerabilities (CWE-78) in GitHub Actions workflows. All findings are true positives with clear remediation recommendations.
next_steps: Run iDoFT evaluation for flaky test detection metrics
Evaluate DAST agent on OWASP WebGoat
Measure remediation quality via PR generation
Calculate MTTD/MTTR metrics over longer timeframe
